title: Name Bias and Blind Resumes
description: A quick, practical guide to Name Bias and Blind Resumes.

hook.text: Identical resumes with different names get wildly different callback rates.

buildup.text: A famous study sent 5,000 resumes. 'White-sounding' names got 50% more callbacks.

discovery.text: This isn't conscious malice. It's implicit bias â€” fast judgments based on familiarity.

twist.text: Some companies now use blind resume screening, removing names and photos entirely.

climax.text: Orchestras did this first. Blind auditions behind screens doubled women's success.
